content.description: This traverse is close to ground, starts on the left, and faces west. Start with easy dyno, traverse across the overhang, inside small incut you can get a right leg rest before two great dynos. The exit dyno is on the right boulder.
content.protection: This is a boulder problem close to ground, so no pad is needed.
content.location:
From flat area at top of entrance west chimney, proceed left north past a large, dead juniper. Drop down 5', pass a small boulder, then go down again. To your right is a great V4 traverse that starts on the left where the chalk is under a small overhang and finishes with two dynos and back up the 5' drop.

Another 5.7 crack climb is on the 30' right before entering where the boulder and 5' drop is.

This traverse is below a killer 25' prow that is unclimbed. The 25' slot on the left has been TR.

pathTokens: North Fork of the St. Vrain River
